elements.description: Mismatch between between expected bundled resources and actual bundled resources. The manifest expects a resource to be in the bundle, but it was not found in the bundle. This is typically the case when a non-excluded resource was modified between publishing the bundle and publishing the manifest.
elements.name: resource.LIVEUPDATE_BUNDLED_RESOURCE_MISMATCH

elements.description: Mismatch between running engine version and engine versions supported by manifest.
elements.name: resource.LIVEUPDATE_ENGINE_VERSION_MISMATCH

elements.description: Failed to parse manifest data buffer. The manifest was probably produced by a different engine version.
elements.name: resource.LIVEUPDATE_FORMAT_ERROR

elements.description: Mismatch between scheme used to load resources. Resources are loaded with a different scheme than from manifest, for example over HTTP or directly from file. This is typically the case when running the game directly from the editor instead of from a bundle.
elements.name: resource.LIVEUPDATE_SCHEME_MISMATCH

elements.description: Mismatch between manifest expected signature and actual signature.
elements.name: resource.LIVEUPDATE_SIGNATURE_MISMATCH

elements.description: Mismatch between manifest expected version and actual version.
elements.name: resource.LIVEUPDATE_VERSION_MISMATCH

elements.description: Return a reference to the Manifest that is currently loaded.

returnvalues.doc: number reference to the Manifest that is currently loaded
returnvalues.name: manifest_reference

elements.brief: return a reference to the Manifest that is currently loaded
elements.name: resource.get_current_manifest

elements.description: Loads the resource data for a specific resource.

parameters.doc: string The path to the resource
parameters.name: path

returnvalues.doc: buffer Returns the buffer stored on disc
returnvalues.name: buffer

elements.examples:
-- read custom resource data into buffer
local buffer = resource.load("/resources/datafile")

In order for the engine to include custom resources in the build process, you need to specify them in the "game.project" settings file:

[project]
title = My project
version = 0.1
custom_resources = resources/,assets/level_data.json
elements.name: resource.load

elements.description: Sets the resource data for a specific resource

parameters.doc: string | hash The path to the resource
parameters.name: path

parameters.doc: buffer The buffer of precreated data, suitable for the intended resource type
parameters.name: buffer

elements.examples:
Assuming the folder "/res" is added to the project custom resources:

-- load a texture resource and set it on a sprite
local buffer = resource.load("/res/new.texturec")
resource.set(go.get("#sprite", "texture0"), buffer)
elements.name: resource.set

elements.description: Sets the pixel data for a specific texture.

parameters.doc: hash | string The path to the resource
parameters.name: path

parameters.doc:
table A table containing info about the texture. Supported entries:

type
number The texture type. Supported values:
  • resource.TEXTURE_TYPE_2D
width
number The width of the texture (in pixels)
height
number The width of the texture (in pixels)
format
number The texture format. Supported values:
  • resource.TEXTURE_FORMAT_LUMINANCE
  • resource.TEXTURE_FORMAT_RGB
  • resource.TEXTURE_FORMAT_RGBA
parameters.name: table

parameters.doc:
buffer The buffer of precreated pixel data

Currently, only 1 mipmap is generated.
parameters.name: buffer

elements.examples:
How to set all pixels of an atlas

function init(self)
  self.height = 128
  self.width = 128
  self.buffer = buffer.create(self.width * self.height, { {name=hash("rgb"), type=buffer.VALUE_TYPE_UINT8, count=3} } )
  self.stream = buffer.get_stream(self.buffer, hash("rgb"))

  for y=1,self.height do
      for x=1,self.width do
          local index = (y-1) * self.width * 3 + (x-1) * 3 + 1
          self.stream[index + 0] = 0xff
          self.stream[index + 1] = 0x80
          self.stream[index + 2] = 0x10
      end
  end

  local resource_path = go.get("#sprite", "texture0")
  local header = { width=self.width, height=self.height, type=resource.TEXTURE_TYPE_2D, format=resource.TEXTURE_FORMAT_RGB, num_mip_maps=1 }
  resource.set_texture( resource_path, header, self.buffer )
end
elements.name: resource.set_texture

elements.description: Create a new manifest from a buffer. The created manifest is verified by ensuring that the manifest was signed using the bundled public/private key-pair during the bundle process and that the manifest supports the current running engine version. Once the manifest is verified it is stored on device. The next time the engine starts (or is rebooted) it will look for the stored manifest before loading resources. Storing a new manifest allows the developer to update the game, modify existing resources, or add new resources to the game through LiveUpdate.

parameters.doc: string the binary data that represents the manifest
parameters.name: manifest_buffer

parameters.doc:
function(self, status) the callback function executed once the engine has attempted to store the manifest.

self
object The current object.
status
constant the status of the store operation:
  • resource.LIVEUPATE_OK
  • resource.LIVEUPATE_INVALID_RESOURCE
  • resource.LIVEUPATE_VERSION_MISMATCH
  • resource.LIVEUPATE_ENGINE_VERSION_MISMATCH
  • resource.LIVEUPATE_SIGNATURE_MISMATCH
  • resource.LIVEUPDATE_BUNDLED_RESOURCE_MISMATCH
  • resource.LIVEUPDATE_FORMAT_ERROR
parameters.name: callback

elements.brief: create, verify, and store a manifest to device
elements.examples:
How to download a manifest with HTTP and store it on device.

local function store_manifest_cb(self, status)
  if status == resource.LIVEUPATE_OK then
    pprint("Successfully stored manifest. This manifest will be loaded instead of the bundled manifest the next time the engine starts.")
  else
    pprint("Failed to store manifest")
  end
end

local function download_and_store_manifest(self)
  http.request(MANIFEST_URL, "GET", function(self, id, response)
      if response.status == 200 then
        resource.store_manifest(response.response, store_manifest_cb)
      end
    end)
end
elements.name: resource.store_manifest

elements.description: add a resource to the data archive and runtime index. The resource will be verified internally before being added to the data archive.

parameters.doc: number The manifest to check against.
parameters.name: manifest_reference

parameters.doc: string The resource data that should be stored.
parameters.name: data

parameters.doc: string The expected hash for the resource, retrieved through collectionproxy.missing_resources.
parameters.name: hexdigest

parameters.doc:
function(self, hexdigest, status) The callback function that is executed once the engine has been attempted to store the resource.

self
object The current object.
hexdigest
string The hexdigest of the resource.
status
boolean Whether or not the resource was successfully stored.
parameters.name: callback

elements.brief: add a resource to the data archive and runtime index
elements.examples:
function init(self)
    self.manifest = resource.get_current_manifest()
end

local function callback_store_resource(self, hexdigest, status)
     if status == true then
          print("Successfully stored resource: " .. hexdigest)
     else
          print("Failed to store resource: " .. hexdigest)
     end
end

local function load_resources(self, target)
     local resources = collectionproxy.missing_resources(target)
     for _, resource_hash in ipairs(resources) do
          local baseurl = "http://example.defold.com:8000/"
          http.request(baseurl .. resource_hash, "GET", function(self, id, response)
               if response.status == 200 then
                    resource.store_resource(self.manifest, response.response, resource_hash, callback_store_resource)
               else
                    print("Failed to download resource: " .. resource_hash)
               end
          end)
     end
end
elements.name: resource.store_resource
